website_summaries.verdict: With few concerns and quality craftsmanship that's built to last, this rugged grill is portable, practical, and perfect for anyone who needs a small but useful outdoor cooking space.
pros: Superior cast iron construction by a company with more than 100 years in the industry
Ideal for small groups, thanks to the 17-by-9 inch cooking surface
cons: Handle could be sturdier, as it seems a bit thin to accommodate the weight of the grill

website_summaries.verdict: For high-heat grilling such as hibachi cooking, this cast iron grill can handle the challenge. Be prepared for the extra care required to keep it in perfect shape for years to come.
pros: Simple to put together with few parts to bolt on
Heats evenly and reliably thanks to cast iron construction
cons: Grill surface has no raised edges, so hot dogs can roll off
Care must be taken in cleaning
Grill must be covered if stored outside
At 32 pounds, carrying it is a bear

customer_reviews.title: Great grill but the grate does not hold up.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Lodge cast iron sportsmen grill that I have purchased . IT meets my needs and is a great grill. however the grill grate does not last more than two years. the Cast Iron Grate erodes and falls apart. I have tried to purchase a new grate without success from Lodge. which means that I have to replace the whole Hibachi grill
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: "Exactly what I wanted!!!!" That's why I bought two of them!
customer_reviews.text: These grills are great for short quick cooking and small to medium sized meals. You can even place sauce pans and frying pans on them for camping and home use. I purchased two of them in December 2012 for $69.97 each. However, at $116.00 I would never pay that price for this identical item produced by the identical manufacture. Make sure you protect your hibachi by spraying it entirely with "Pam" or Canola oil spray before and after use. It helps also to purchase a cover designed for the hibachi.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.  Wonder what modifications people have made to it.
customer_reviews.text: This is great for one to four (max.) people when you don't want to waste charcoal in a larger grill. Thoughtful design, in that you can flip grill to get food closer to fire if you want. I would really like to see how some people have tweaked this design. Air flow is one area that could be improved. You won't be cooking ribs in any traditional way, but for steaks, chicken, burgers, pork tenderloin and similar, this is a more intimate experience and will use somewhat less charcoal to get to searing temperatures and is real grilling, not a kettle, which has its own plusses, like cooking ribs.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy Dave

customer_reviews.title: Cooking grill DISINTEGRATED after 1 year. Metal in food is NG
customer_reviews.text: Not the best grill I bought over the years. After a few month the cast iron grill starts to DISINTEGRATE. Quality cast iron should not do this. I make cast iron molds at my work and know how it should last and believe me on this one it's the absolute worst I ever seen, Engine blocks and exhaust manifolds reach higher temps and last forever. This grill delaminate's GETTING CHUNKS OF CAST IRON ON YOUR FOOD. Iron is good for you but not that much :)
customer_reviews.author: SoCal

customer_reviews.title: Best Hibachi on the Market
customer_reviews.text: This is the best hibachi grill around. I love mine! It does take more fuel than you would think, but works great. If you own one, you need to clean it after each use then apply vegetable oil to all the parts to prevent rust. I spray mine down with coconut oil spray after each use, then tear it down and store it indoors. Because of this, I only use it for parties, but that's fine. If I want fast and convenient I use the gas grill. If I want great food, I use the Lodge Sportsman. This entire grill is made in the USA, and if cared for properly, will last a few life times. A great product!
customer_reviews.author: 5.0 Engine

customer_reviews.title: American made, high quality castings.
customer_reviews.text: The cooking grate can stand on its feet like in the picture or it can be flipped over so the the food is closer to the coals. The drafting door works well to control the heat of the coals. It assembles in a snap and after letting it heat up for 25 minutes after assembly, I was coking kabobs. 25 after cooking the kabobs I threw on some whole mushrooms and there was plenty of heat left for that. I set the grill on small aluminum table. I haven't owned a charcoal grill in 20 years and I really like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry L

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy w/ Results!
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with my small grill. Took 5 minutes to put together. I use it to make tandoori chicken and veggies on my first try. Worked out perfectly. I fed 4 adults so the sizing was just right. I’m excited to try more things. It distributed the heat evenly. I rubbed the grill down with olive oil so food didn’t stick. Make sure to have an oven mitt to use the heat control slide. Came in handy when the mesquite was burning too hot. Solid product!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: BROKEN
customer_reviews.text: It arrived with broken fire grate in half. Due to my heavy work traveling, it was too late to return and now it would cost me $35.00 to buy the part. Plus, returning might not be easy as it is very heavy and perhaps no one would hear the complain after 6 months, but at least I can share my feedback.
customer_reviews.author: ChungWei

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Grill!
customer_reviews.text: My dream came true yesterday! I love this grill. I have invested in different kind of grills but never found the perfect one. This grill produced an amazing result. Pros: -Amazing result inside out as long as you put enough charcoals -Easy setup and clean up after use -Easy usage (from prep until the final result) Cons: -Heavy. -Round shapes on the side, which I think it's not efficient for storage. -Need a constant effort to maintain it from rust. Other than that, this is a perfect outdoor grill. Well recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Master

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best grill in it's class, with second place not even close. I would consider it perfect if the grilling surface did not have the round Lodge logo right in the grill center. For me, this puts round burn marks on tortillas, fish, and other grill items. I would think this grill better if the grilling surface was just the thick bars with no round logo. Lodge already has a logo on the fire door, so why spoil the grill surface for those cooks good enough to control their grill marks ?
customer_reviews.author: Demeter

customer_reviews.title: wanted a small grill so I didn't need to start up Weber
customer_reviews.text: Just me and my wife so starting Weber takes a long time just for two of use -- Bought a Blackstone griddle which is great Charcoal give a real BBQ taste so I got this . Thought I was doing sometime wrong putting it together since it take two bolts . Went on you tube and spent more time seeing why it was so easy . For grilling its a charcoal grill which means you need to watch it or you will burn your food .
customer_reviews.author: red011565

customer_reviews.title: Built to last
customer_reviews.text: This is one solid grill. It's just the right size for a couple of burgers or steaks. My son uses is regularly to cook meat on skewers, to which it seems especially adapted. This is not some flimsy metal bucket. It is solid. I like that it does not allow ash to fall through the bottom. The cast iron body holds the charcoal nicely (I use one of those starter chimneys to get the charcoal lit, then pour it into the grill), and seems better at holding and distributing heat than my old mini-grill (I had a mini Weber grill). And the oblong layout seems more usable than my old grill's round layout.
customer_reviews.author: SCOTT A STOCKWELL

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Durability.
customer_reviews.text: It’s heavyyy, and the wire handle they provide isn’t forgiving on the hand. It’s easy to assemble and after a few minutes of cooking I started to get the hang of controlling the temperature, it’s a tricky thing but once you get the airflow right it’s fantastic. Follow the instructions for seasoning after cooking and you’re golden. It’ll last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hess

customer_reviews.title: Great product, only wished two things were different.
customer_reviews.text: Tried this for the first time since receiving it. This thing has some bulk to it and seems like it will outlast me! It grilled up a couple of rib eyes really easily. I like the door for the coals as it made it easy to add fruit tree branches for added flavor. A couple of things I wished they would've done was to have four feet instead of three for added stability and a lift out tray for the ashes. Overall I would highly recommend this over other flimsy ones I had before.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy
customer_reviews.text: Well made product but the grate is too high even when it’s turned upside down. I can never seem to get it hot enough unless I pile the charcoal high which defeats the purpose of having a small grill
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Montalto

customer_reviews.title: Use it several times a week. Easy and convenient.
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot! In fact I pretty much use it every other day. The only reason I gave it a 4 star is that I'm using it so much that I'd like to buy a replacement cooking grate, and I can't find one. The one I am currently using looks like it might be starting to rust. I also think it's a little on the costly side. But it was definitely not a problem to put together and immediately start using.
customer_reviews.author: Cherrymom

customer_reviews.title: Cooks great!
customer_reviews.text: After first use the top grill grate I noticed a crack. Lodge requested I send a pic and mailing address. A week later ups delivered the new grill grate was delivered. Lodge stands behave nd their products. Now about the grill. Gets very hot and I love the sizzle it gives. Food taste better on the cast iron grill. Cooking area is small but good for 2-3. If you are into cast iron get this grill you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: gafleeman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, fun, 10 stars
customer_reviews.text: Absolute game over. Best toy in 10 years. Amazing food, all natural, taken it everywhere, perfect. Fun to try to get the lodge logo on stuff and this plantain really took. Thank you lodge for making this.
customer_reviews.author: drewbsn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect 2-person grill
customer_reviews.text: I sous vide quite a bit and purchased this grill to brown food. It does that perfectly. However, I have started to use when cooking for 1 or 2 people. Much less charcoal wasted. Like all cast iron, the cooking grate takes awhile to heat up. However, once hot, it stays hot and is perfect for those sear marks. HACK...before using the first time, wash cooking grate, then season the way you would a cast iron or carbon steel skillet. You will be more pleased with the cooking and clean-up process.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: My goto grill
customer_reviews.text: After over a year of heavy, and I mean heavy use, I can honestly say from a chef of over 27 years, this is an awesome grill. I use it at least 3 times per week. Once it gets hot, it stays hot and meat doesn't stick. As long as it is well cleaned before hand. Don't hesitate to purchase this cast iron grill or anything from Lodge or Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Say HELLO to my LiL FRIEND
customer_reviews.text: I just used my grill and its AWESOME! It is an open grill so no cover to adjust temp, but great for tailgate, small patio. Cooked my food well, eady to add coal or wood chips while cooking, easy temp air control slider. 100% cast iron.... very hot! Easy to move around and use right away! It's my new lil friend!
customer_reviews.author: SZEPNSHER

customer_reviews.title: cracked cast iron!!
customer_reviews.text: I mean how do you Crack cast iron!!! My item showed up at my house completely cracked...i.am pretty mad!!
customer_reviews.author: kbk12

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item and the second time I used it, it cracked. I’ve tried contacting Lodge by chat and email and they don’t respond. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted one of these for years and "FINALLY" my birthday wish came true! It is superb with only 2-bolts to assemble it. Whom ever designed this was an intellectual. I'll keep my Weber smoker for only that reason but primarily I shall use this cast iron baby every week surely. I LOVE IT~ Yeah babae!
customer_reviews.author: John Michael

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for our small family
customer_reviews.text: We bought our cast iron grill to take on trips and camping, but for our first use we decided to make brats and hotdogs on our front patio with my parents. So this fed four adults and a toddler easily and was a joy to cook on! More space than I originally thought.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Hill

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a family of 4 - light duty grilling
customer_reviews.text: We typically use our propane grill for heavy duty/bulk work, but when the occasion arises, I pull this out. Does an amazing sear and imparts the charcoal flavor that is so memorable. Excellent, build quality - 11/10 would buy again - but won't need to. I will pass this on to my son, who will pass it onto his son, and so on and so on. Can't wait for grilling season again. A bit too heavy for backpacking or camping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great hibachi! The hamburgers and steaks I have made ...
customer_reviews.text: Two bolts to assemble. Great hibachi! The hamburgers and steaks I have made on this are phenomenal. The only thing I wished was that somebody would have told me how much charcoal to use. I would recommend starting with 45 pieces of charcoal for hamburgers and steaks. I used 60 to do some T-bones and it cooked very fast, even with the grill turned up. In many instances, 40 may be too few. I lined it with aluminum foil as recommended by another, and that helped with cleanup. I have owned many hibachies in my lifetime, and this is absolutely the best ever.
customer_reviews.author: Big D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, if it wasn’t cracked.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble (2 minutes literally) , it is heavy but the size makes it easy to transport (excellent for camping, night at the beach or quick burgers in the backyard). Unfortunately the cooking grate came cracked twice(even after requesting a replacement). It is too much hassle to return the whole grill again for a crack but it’s a shame giving the quality of the product. Would definitely buy it again, but probably from the local camping store instead of doing it online.
customer_reviews.author: A. Nasso

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little grill!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic!!! One of my best purchases and the best grill I ever had. Small, super-easy to assemble, to clean, to cook! Everything ig so friendly. Outstanding quality, very well packaged. It uses small amount of charcoal, heat is even all around, you can cook 8 hamburger patties Make sure you keep it clean and dry, and will last forever!!
customer_reviews.author: pacapo23

customer_reviews.title: Great Hibachi
customer_reviews.text: Cooking over an open flame, this grill gets HOT. I mean like over 800 degrees F hot. I used wood chunks and you can really get a great sear on steaks with this, you can also dial back a bit for other types of cooking but it really shines when you are trying to get that great sear.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne AutumnTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Cracked after first wash.
customer_reviews.text: Everything was honestly great but the handle just feels a bit off. It’s thin & makes the cover fit a title weird. Cook perfectly & it’s the perfect size. Cooked dinner for 3 very easily. However, I attempted to clean it the day after I used it. I dried it off completely & stored it & I came back to it cracked. (The bottom part)
customer_reviews.author: lindsey

customer_reviews.title: fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I love this Grill! I bought it for using our cast iron frying pan, griddle, and Dutch oven instead of over a fire when not at the cabin or camping. Works like a champ for that, I set it up on my Oklahoma Joes Grill when the weather allows. Building a large steel table for the 3 season room to use it there for cooking when it’s nasty out. Wish I would have found this years ago. Thanks for the speedy delivery and Thanks to Lodge for another Quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Jay B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Grill if you know how to treat it right!
customer_reviews.text: Holds heat, and is great as a grill. Although small, cooks fast so you can actually put out a decent amount of food. Make sure you don't leave it outside in humid weather without a good coat of oil and a cover. Or just take it indoors after your done and its cooled off.
customer_reviews.author: MattCurryCom

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: This grill is reminiscent over the old style Hibachi grills, but so much better! You can control the heat better, good for cooking items on the grill and in pan on top. The bail type handle is very nice for moving a hot grill where you want it, or setting in out of the weather if rain starts. I am extremely happy with this product overall!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Koger

customer_reviews.title: Lodge brand cast iron!
customer_reviews.text: Like every item of Lodge cast iron cookware, this Sportsman's Grill performs very well. The grill has two height positions. I use the lower position for grilling steaks and the higher setting for burgers, chicken and sausage. I love the way steaks turn out, grilled on this little marvel!
customer_reviews.author: Dorena Mountain Man

customer_reviews.title: total control
customer_reviews.text: made in the USA #1 grill for one or two big steaks, you can cook right up to edge and still get even char. reversible grill face makes it easy to just sear or full cook. excellent tool designed to last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: toddc

customer_reviews.title: Gets hot. Needs to cool before transporting.
customer_reviews.text: Great grill. Had one years ago. Same great lodge product. Only reason for 4stars is the grill door. Not tight enough., will open when moving. Still have a griddle that fits so the best of all worlds. Think it should come with a cover.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R. Moss

customer_reviews.title: Top 5 purchase on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Love this little grill. One of the best things I’ve ever purchased on Amazon. The heat distribution is unbelievable, and have no problem cooking multiple things at once. The one hiccup is the portability. It’s a bit on the heavy side for a weekend camping trip, and if you hold it by the handle the weight shifts to the front. I’ve cooked with charcoal, cherry wood and sassafras and have had no issues with getting it up to temperature. Would recommend to any and everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I could not be happier!
customer_reviews.text: being new to cast iron stuff , and really enjoying charcoal cooking, I purchased this set up. It is typical great Lodge quality. Please watch a couple Tube videos to help you decide, but you won't regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: terry

customer_reviews.title: Cover sold separately
customer_reviews.text: Love this Grill! Just wish it had a lid for slow cookin (even if it wasn’t cast iron). Should include the cover as it definitely needs if it doesn’t live on a covered porch. Obviously not light weight but it gonna last FOREVER.
customer_reviews.author: Adoria Elias

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with this grill. My wife and I had some guests over and this grill was magic. I can't imagine buying any other grill.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Olvera

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: WOW a great grill!!! Very heavy in weight, Cleans very good. Have had no problems with rusting, but of course i always coat it with spray PAM and wipe over it before storing it. It really uses very small amount of charcoal to get a nice hot fire. Excellent for Kabobs.(I simply do not put the grill plate on) The skewers fit great on the edges of the grill making it so easy to turn.The only negative thing that I could say about this grill is the handle definitely does not balance the grill-- it wants to flip the grill forward when lifting by the handle. Otherwise very very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Mrdchw

customer_reviews.title: Great all around grill. Perfect if cooking for two! Keep it Clean and Seasoned!
customer_reviews.text: This grill is amazing. Takes some TLC to keep clean, but it will last forever if you take care of it. Make a quick meal for two, or a whole family. This thing puts out some power, so keep an eye on your meat! Get the cover, Cast Iron is sensitive if you just leave it sitting around.
customer_reviews.author: Saul McClintock

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Camping grill
customer_reviews.text: Heavy Duty, high quality, easy to assemble. Perfect for camping. It is Heavy but that’s expected from all cast iron body. Would HIGHLY recommend.
customer_reviews.author: GR57X

customer_reviews.title: Fill correctly
customer_reviews.text: I love the size of the cooking service for my husband and I. Before use instructed to wipe first, only a little residue of black. Made well, stable and level on my cement porch. Easy to clean after use.Love this grill.
customer_reviews.author: Jewell

customer_reviews.title: Love cast iron products
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this grill for traveling and camping. It it's our go to grill SMS has a decent cooking area
customer_reviews.author: Sara B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Like all of my Lodge cookware, this bbq is fantastic and another heirloom product that will outlive me and pass down for a generation to last the test of time. The bbq has an air slide gate to control the temperature but it really doesn’t apply to this cooker - don’t overload the coals and add as need through the coal drawer. Awesome rig!
customer_reviews.author: Davy J

customer_reviews.title: My first charcoal grill and not going back to propane
customer_reviews.text: I love cooking with this hibachi grill! I had only cooked with a propane grill before this one. Transitioning to charcoal was easier than I thought and I prefer the flavor. Be careful to keep water/rain away as it will rust pretty quickly so keep it covered after use.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would b perfect for our porch during inclement weather, due to its size. However the grill height is not adjustable in anyway. The unit is very heavy, so portability may be a problem and it is smaller than expected, so quantity is limited.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Lady

customer_reviews.title: Excellent size
customer_reviews.text: Had one from years ago and won’t part with them, best grill ever!
customer_reviews.author: CarCar

customer_reviews.title: Elegantly Simple, Fuel Efficient
customer_reviews.text: I love this grill! Elegantly simple. Easy to assemble (two screws, everything else slides into place). Portable - but about 30 lbs, so substantial. Lodge quality. Cooks beautifully, gives even heat and retains it, very fuel efficient. Perfect for cooking for one or two! I will take this /with me when I move abroad next year.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne M. Derringer

customer_reviews.title: High quality product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very high quality product that is manufactured and finished well. We bought it for home use, and it is ideally suited for that purpose. Very pleased with the product and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: John L. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Thank Heaven for little grills
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoying using this little grill. Coals ready very quickly taking the hassle out of a quick charcoal grilled dinner. Quick and charcoal grilling don’t usually go together. Portability is perfect. State camp grounds have grills but at an awkward position for cooking dinner or who knows what’s been on there! I love my wee grilly!
customer_reviews.author: Sterlingchic

customer_reviews.title: GREAT COOKWARE!
customer_reviews.text: I love this grill. Many complain that it rusts out,..it's cast iron Folks! Must be treated the same as a cast iron skillet,..season, and store in a DRY place. Much better that the standard Hibatchi grills!
customer_reviews.author: Paul W.

customer_reviews.title: Gift for my husband
customer_reviews.text: We looked around many grills. We could't find any that satisfy our desire to purchase. Many are too big and not so impressive. My husband wanted cast-iron grill which is easy to move around. This is the one exactly what he wanted. He was very happy to received as an gift from me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would buy it again in a heartbeat
customer_reviews.text: My one negative is the draw strings of the “canvas” cover is way too tight and almost impossible to get on. I lengthened the drawstring at least 8 inches and it’s still too tight. The only other annoyance is the wire handle, cleverly designed but can too easily be dislodged from its mount. One fix is to close the loops in the handle but then can’t remove it if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT P FRANKLIN

customer_reviews.title: Will enjoy using this summer
customer_reviews.text: Very few choices in hibachi's in America. Still long for my real Japanese antique one from years ago. But this is a solid make from a trusted company. Will enjoy using this summer. Nice room on grill plate--bigger than most hibachis.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great grill for small batches of food on the go.
customer_reviews.text: Cooks great only downside is that the grate only has 2 settings so temp control is how much charcoal you use and how far away from the flame the food is. Little on the heavy side but overall love the taste of the food grilled on it. Make sure to keep it properly seasoned and it won't rust.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Hurd

customer_reviews.title: Always loved Lodge castiron
customer_reviews.text: Always loved Lodge castiron...always will. This little grill is awesome. If your a camper, prepper, Boy Scout or just someone that likes old fashioned cast iron to cook on...get this. So happy I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Rich

customer_reviews.title: Pre seasonded but does rust quick
customer_reviews.text: I rinsed this and let it dry was rusty in minutes. nice grill though does very well. Wish you could move the grates more as it's so small can get too hot.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little grill!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little grill. Easy to setup and use. Performs perfectly and really doesn't require much charcoal at all! I was impressed with how little charcoal it requires. I use this all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Stephan

customer_reviews.title: Our go - to grub hub !
customer_reviews.text: We have enjoyed these guys for decades ... They outlast low- end cast iron cooking grills and I am thinking it’s the cohesive design and comparatively high quality. Low temp cooking ( shrimp fish veggies )is improved my adding a small angle iron baffle- high end heat is no problem ! Chow! Ciao !
customer_reviews.author: james lukas

customer_reviews.title: B B Q Time
customer_reviews.text: liked it is small enough to carry in trunk of car, easy to store, great for a quick cook out, just enough for 2 people ,have been using it since I got it
customer_reviews.author: frisky-frisco-1

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Grill
customer_reviews.text: This grill is heavy duty. The cast iron maintains heat evenly. This is a well built grill and I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a good, durable, portable grill.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Edit: Update, contacted Lodge concerning missing parts. They responded w/in 24 hours and requested a picture of the product I received. They immediately shipped the missing parts at no cost. The grill is a great product, heavy duty but light enough to carry. The customer service was amazing. Thank you! Item was missing both the wire ball amd draft door upon receipt, making it impossible to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Carol B.

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this
customer_reviews.text: Dont do it! You can get the same or better results with a 14 dollar Walmart special. The dampner achieves nothing with reguards to temperature control. You will have flare ups, and have to keep constant vigil not to burn things.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J Foster

customer_reviews.title: It's a Lodge what else can you say!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It's heavy like a any Lodge product. We bbq more nights than not. Propane is faster and we do that a lot. But nothing beats charcoal.
customer_reviews.author: N Dorsett

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy!
customer_reviews.text: Used about a half a dozen times as of now, slightly larger then anticipated, great small grill, do not store/leave out in the elements. Found that spraying the entire grill with canola cooking spray while hot acts same as seasoning it.
customer_reviews.author: Faith or Val

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a champ in every way. It is heavy because it is sturdy. Assembly was a breeze and I did cure it in the oven as recommended. There is no more efficient way to cook awesome charcoal grilled food. The size is great for a meal solo or for up to 4 people and cleanup is a breeze. My Lodge is now part of my regular appliances and I plan to have my relatives fight over its ownership once I am dead.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Bigger then I thought it was going to be!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m using it tonight! Two screws to assemble! Looks perfect, and it should be a great grill! Much bigger then I thought it was going to be!
customer_reviews.author: Jbone

customer_reviews.title: Love this grill
customer_reviews.text: Being single, I didn't need nor want a large, cumbersome grill, and I love all things cast iron. With proper care it should last decades like all cast iron pieces. I can easily lift off the grill top to clean after each use and seasoning is not such a chore. Also great for movable feasts and easily put away at the end of the season, although, with the easy use, not sure I'll be putting this treasure away. I suggest getting the grill cover for it and a stainless steel rolling table to fit it as I did.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Great little Grill
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this little grill. We have a nice large gas grill and we use it all the time for large groups, or when we want quick grill time...but for small amounts, this baby is terrific. I love that as the charcoal cooks down to grey, the grill surface is getting very hot....you get instant heat from the heavy cast iron grates that put those great grill marks --and with the little door to get to the coals, you can push them to one side for a cool side/hot/side effect. My favorite use is to to shrimp ka-bobs. Very quick and great grill taste.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly J. Tuft

customer_reviews.title: hibachi style all day
customer_reviews.text: There something about cooking on cast iron that drives me wild...the food...it just tastes better...I have used both coal and wood on this baby and food came out excellent. Fair warning...don't cheap out buy the sportsman cover, and for this to work at its best you will need to fill it completely with coal or wood. Its no like the weber round grills where you can get nice and hot with about 20 coals...this is cast iron...and needs as much coal as possible to get HOT
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: great grill. first bowl cracked in 3 places but Lodge customer service sent a new bowl right out. had to disassemble and reassemble but big deal. works great for 3-4 servings maybe without sides on grill. I grill a lot on much bigger grill so this is only for small cooks but just as affective
customer_reviews.author: Cross U

customer_reviews.title: Cast iron FTW
customer_reviews.text: I love this little grill. It's ideal for two people, and is built like a tank. Combine with a Weber Chimney starter for no hassle grilling. I like how the cast iron holds the heat and cooks evenly. There is nothing to break with this grill; all you need to do is keep it clean and it'll last longer than you will. I recommend the fabric cover to keep moisture away. Most importantly, the food that come off this thing tastes great. No question the food off of it has the perfect grilled taste. Not sure how practical for camping, unless you're tail-gating. It's heavy. That's expected- it's solid cast iron. Fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Larccc

customer_reviews.title: Grills Evenly
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my camp since I am mostly cooking for four or less. Tried it with some burgers and it grilled evenly and consistently. It is HEAVY... not so portable. I would not be taking this camping! I am looking forward to years to come with this grill.
customer_reviews.author: Beck

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: My grill arrived even sooner than expected, and it was very easy to assemble! I could not be happier with this quality product! One thing people need to know is that this grill is quite heavy! I've been looking for just the right grill for some time, and am sooo glad that I came to Amazon and saw this one! It's the perfect size and shape and it will definately last forever! It is always a pleasure to do business with Amazon; if you're in the market for a grill, Amazon is the place to go!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie J

customer_reviews.title: A beast
customer_reviews.text: Like the size. Needs to be stored on a dry place...it is cast iron. Sturdy HEAVY grill. Not as easy to transport as you would think. Purchased to use on camping trips, after a few test runs in the back yard, it won’t be going on the road.
customer_reviews.author: PQPantry

customer_reviews.title: High quality.  Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used, yet, but very heavy. Believe it will be very durable. Primary purchase for emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Parts manufactured incorrectly.
customer_reviews.text: Parts manufactured with bolt holes not matching up. Not just a little, a lot. Holes are Chamfered for screws on the wrong side. I will have to use a mill to straighten things up. Hardware was missing. Once I get it out of the metal shop it should work ok.
customer_reviews.author: D George Rose

customer_reviews.title: Yuo get what you pay for!!
customer_reviews.text: Pure American made art!! There is much more to this grill than meets the eye - as a quality engineer (recently retired) specializing in cylinder blocks and cylinder heads castings - you can rest assured this grill will become a family heirloom. Another piece of Lodge "iron" added to my collection. Lodge does it right!
customer_reviews.author: Beekeeper

customer_reviews.title: Great portable grill!
customer_reviews.text: Love this grill! Heavy as hell but durable and easy to use. Actually surprised by how much temp control you have with it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY.
customer_reviews.text: After a seemingly interminable wait (the seller stated that a replacement was issued, the original deemed lost?), I received the grill. Almost a one month wait. Nonetheless, the grill arrived intact (the additional box it was shipped in was quite deformed by the package carrier, somewhat a la Jim Carrie in the film, 'Pet Detective'). If you order, whether or not you will experience the same wait is unknown (but probable, given similar critique posted by a couple of other commentators.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Azymov

customer_reviews.title: A consistent little grill
customer_reviews.text: This small hibachi has helped a grill challenged person like me to finally produce consistent results. So far I've grilled steak, hot dogs, kabobs and chicken which all turned out well. Prior efforts on larger barbecue grills were disappointing in comparison. I never got the hang of them; this Lodge, though, fires up nicely and being cast iron retains heat well. Of course, the downsides are you'll need a cover to protect it from the rain. The grill has no edges so hot dogs can roll off and there are only two height adjustments. But even with those short comings, I'd buy this grill again.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Easy to grill out!
customer_reviews.text: I love love this grill. Bought it for myself for mother’s day! Lol! It’s nonstick. Just make sure to oil it before and after cooking. Took about 40 charcoal brickets. Used a small Weber Chimney fire starter. Super easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: MissNDMelo

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this little thing!
customer_reviews.text: A solid little unit and while it's just perfect to grill one or two burgers and not waste a bunch of charcoal, but I did cook an entire cut up chicken on there yesterday and it fit just fine., I did make an entire cut up chicken on there yesterday and there was plenty of room. This makes it FUN to cook for one or two instead of my other grills where one burger looked so darn lonely! Also a great size for kabobs ;) Cast iron - you can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Mar

customer_reviews.title: This is a "Must Have".
customer_reviews.text: It's not for big families. But for us, the family of 4, it's perfect. It's a must have. And we believe we can pass it to the next generation, if we take cares of it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Grill
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Lodge Sportsman Grill to replace a Weber 10020 Smokey Joe 14-Inch Portable Grill that baked rather than grilled food. We couldn't be happier. The Lodge will likely last 100 years.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G

customer_reviews.title: Hot and Easy
customer_reviews.text: This product is just what you want in a hibachi...it's easy to start and it gets really hot, really fast. The preseasoned griddle can cook on two different levels and the heat can be adjusted by way of a damper. We bought ours primarily to sear steaks quickly leaving them medium rare to rare. If that's what you want then that's what you get. It's heavy duty cast iron throughout with obvious attention to detail and I'm sure this cooker will still be going when my warranty expires. I suggest using natural lump type charcoal, not briquets, and a stack starter.
customer_reviews.author: J H Towns

customer_reviews.title: Fire me up!
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a small, but very STURDY, grill since our family has downsized over time. I use cast iron daily in my kitchen and this is just the ticket for us. Fits a few steaks or about 4 hamburgers at one time. Just right! Easy clean up. No problem with rust if you keep it covered. I had read another review about re-seasoning in the home oven before using, and I did do that. Very happy with it as a small backyard grill.
customer_reviews.author: Livinlite

customer_reviews.title: absolutely the best
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I waited so long to buy this. My husband refuses to eat anything cooked on any gas grill. This grill is so easy to clean out. Old paintbrush and a plastic bag tucked under the feet. I never have to pick it up to dump the ashes. It cooks so evenly and rarely flares up. I have worn out 3 other cheaper grills. After it is cool, (takes a long time) I put a plastic bin over it to cover it. Fits well enough that it won't blow off and keeps rain and snow off. Since it gets so hot my husband made a stand for it on the deck out of two decorative concrete blocks.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lohff

customer_reviews.title: Grill delight
customer_reviews.text: Great for back porch grilling and love the portability for camp out cooking.
customer_reviews.author: marilyn kobialka

customer_reviews.title: Built to last
customer_reviews.text: disliked the vent control slide without any stops because it is not attached where it can't fall off. The lifting handle is useless for me, because the grill is front heavy and not balanced.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Boggs

customer_reviews.title: Lodge, you’ve done it again!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this grill! Perfect for small storage and bringing it on trips/camping. The food tastes amazing and the temperature control is incredible for such a small little grill. It is a great looking grill. I bought it for my husband for Fathers Day and he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grill
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our rv and it is perfect. We love it and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: denise k.

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: looks nice easy to assemble , kind of pricey but will last forever
customer_reviews.author: reptile guy

customer_reviews.title: American made quality.
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly and well made. It was not quite as fancy as I had expected, but looks like it will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: EcoTico

customer_reviews.title: Top marks for a top grill
customer_reviews.text: This is just the coolest little grill! It was quick to assemble and with the limited number of bits it's easy to keep track of, clean up and store. A spell of warm weather brings on the fever for a weenie roast and it sets up in a jiffy. Afterwards the teardown and clean up take very little time. It's ready for the next case of grilling fever. Top marks for a top grill.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: Lodge cookware is some great stuff! Heavy duty, well-engineered, effective. It'll get "up close and personal" with the flames when you flip it upside down so you can get a good sear on steaks or you can flip it over and grill fish. I've cooked steaks, fish, shrimp, lamb, venison, bison and all kinds of veggies on it and will never own another. Is it cheap? No. Is it worth the money? YES!
customer_reviews.author: Dempsy Winans

customer_reviews.title: suprised!
customer_reviews.text: bought this thing and it sat for two years until I gave it to a Gal friend of mine so we could barbecue stakes at her place, now I'm sorry I did although using it once a week or so is better than nothing. Cooking a steak takes some skill however this thing turned it into an absolute joy and the best steaks we have ever had. Have a happy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Lodge Pre-Seasoned Cast Iron Sportsman’s Grill With Coal Door, 10.25" H x 8.25" W x 19" L, Black
product_meta.description:
This rugged, charcoal hibachi-style grill is perfect for picnics, tailgating and car camping or patio. A draft door regulates the heat so in addition to grilling or frying. Ideal for anywhere you need a self contained cooking source coals are accessible behind a flip down door. Grill has two adjustable heights. Seasoned and ready to use. Warning: This product can expose you to Carbon Monoxide, which is a combustion byproduct known to the state of California to cause birth defects or other reproductive harm.

AMAZON.COM
This sturdy cast-iron grill is wonderful for backyard or patio barbecues and rugged enough to go along on camping and fishing trips. The broad grill surface accommodates several whole fish or enough steaks and burgers for a small crowd. The removable draft door regulates the heat, making it simple to keep foods warm and heat coffee or tea in addition to grilling. A second door, decorated with a sunrise marsh scene, opens to provide easy access to the coals. This grill comes with an attached handle for carrying and a built-in shelf for resting utensils. --Jennifer Harris
feature_bullets: One Lodge Pre-Seasoned Cast Iron Sportsman’s Grill With Coal Door
Door allows for coals to be added
Superior heat retention requires less charcoal
17¼ Inch x 9 Inch, Unit size: 19 Inch x 10¼ Inch x 8¼ Inch

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars2,315 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
